channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Under Trump, 317,000 workers are out of the government. Here are 3 of their stories
item.description: Mass firings, buyouts and heightened uncertainty led to an exodus of federal workers in 2025. More than 300,000 employees will be out of the governmen...

item.title: Takeaways from Trump's address. And, some GOP lawmakers shift stance on ACA subsidies
item.description: During a nationwide address, President Trump says the U.S. is poised for an economic boom. And, some Republican lawmakers joined Democrats to force a ...

item.title: ICE is reopening shuttered prisons as detention centers. Many have a troubled past
item.description: In its push for more immigrant detention space, the Trump administration is reopening shuttered prisons in several states. Many of these facilities, c...

item.title: Where we went: NPR's U.S. travel guide for the curious
item.description: NPR's staff traveled a lot in 2025. From a Mardi Gras workshop to a festival celebrating the mythical Mothman, here are some places and events we thou...

item.title: A new 'Avatar,' a marital stand-up story and a gut-wrenching drama are in theaters
item.description: A new drama uses the real, gut-wrenching recordings of a call for help from Gaza to tell a harrowing and profound story.

item.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders start crunch talks on Russia's frozen cash
item.description: The leaders are deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros in frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.

item.title: How the DOJ’s assault charges against protesters are crumbling inside courtrooms
item.description: The Justice Department has embarked on a monthslong effort to prosecute people accused of assaulting federal officers during protests of President Don...

item.title: Family release video of Matilda at beach as aunt calls for 'happiness and love'
item.description: The aunt of the youngest victim of the Bondi shooting says those who are angry should "plant a seed of happiness" in their heart in memory of her niec...

item.title: Dan Bongino stepping down as FBI deputy director
item.description: The ex-podcaster announced he would leave the FBI after US President Donald Trump told reporters he "wants to go back to his show".

item.title: China fumes as White House announces record $10B in arms sales to Taiwan
item.description: The Trump administration's announcement of plan to sell Taiwan a record $10 billion worth of weapons draws an angry response from China.

item.title: French 'Doctor Death' who poisoned patients jailed for life
item.description: A court finds Frédéric Péchier guilty of contaminating infusion bags with substances that caused cardiac arrest or hemorrhaging.

item.title: N.C. Republicans redrew a GOP district. A Democrat is looking to take advantage.
item.description: North Carolina was among the GOP-led states this year that redrew congressional lines mid-decade in an attempt to benefit Republicans.

item.title: Bit by bit, small US groups chip away at historic levels of social isolation
"48 Hours" show schedule
item.description: True crime. Real justice. To miss it would be a crime.

item.title: Philippine hotel says Bondi Beach suspects spent every night in their room
item.description: The father and son suspects in the Bondi Beach terror attack spent most of November in a hotel in the Philippines, but the reason for their visit rema...

item.title: Australian PM announces crackdown on hate speech after Bondi shooting
item.description: Measures include fresh penalties for 'those who spread hate' as well as new powers to cancel or refuse visas.

item.title: "Star anesthetist" sentenced for poisoning 30 patients, killing 12
item.description: Frederic Pechier's youngest victim, four-year-old Teddy, survived two cardiac arrests during routine surgery in 2016. The oldest victim was 89.

item.title: Pulitzer Prize-winning correspondent Peter Arnett, who reported on Vietnam and Gulf wars, has died
